about_the_game:
"Touhou Infinite Nocturne" is a Roguelike role-playing game. In this game, you will take on the role of a team traversing the main stage of the Touhou worldview, Gensokyo, seeking help from friends, battling enemies, encountering various random events, and ultimately determining the fate of Gensokyo.

◆The Final Night of Gensokyo

The Haniwa army from hell has invaded Gensokyo, empowered by an unknown force capable of destroying the realm.
This night has been etched into an endless nightmare... but perhaps you can save it all!

◆Heroes Unite!

Choose three of your favorite Touhou characters and embark on this destined extraordinary journey.
Experiment with different combinations to build a powerful lineup that's all your own!

◆Unique Real-Time Turn-Based Battles

Enemies and characters gain action points over time, with characters even able to hold onto these points for later use. In battle, you can pause time at any moment to observe the situation, and all enemy actions are under your control.
Wait for the opportune moment or attack immediately? Or perhaps make a decision amidst the enemy's actions?

◆Follow the Guidance of the Market God

Under the influence of the Market God, money now rules Gensokyo. Powerful and useful items are priced accordingly, allowing you to rapidly boost your combat strength with wealth. Sell unwanted items, gamble at the casino, try to crack safes, or even earn money from believers through religious influence...
Don't worry, they're all doing it voluntarily.

◆Diverse Gameplay

Adventure demands its fair share of entertainment. Apart from varied locations and events, "Touhou Infinite Nocturne" also includes many minigames: dice gambling, number puzzles, card deck-building, identity deduction...
These minigames have minimal impact on the main game; they primarily serve to grant you some extra rewards.

◆Character Growth and Emotion Management

While enhancing your characters' combat abilities, keep an eye on their emotional fluctuations: characters can become exhausted from continuous battles, harbor resentment due to disagreements in beliefs, or feel remorse over the death of friends... If a character's emotions reach their breaking point, they may act irrationally.
In the face of pain, no one can be a hero...

◆Community Discussions
